item.title: Copper While Waiting For Fiber
item.description: Fiber optic connections are the optimal choice for high bandwidth, offering speeds from 10 Mbps to 10 Gbps using either SONET or Carrier Ethernet protocols. However, accessing these options requires “lit” fiber service, which can take several months or more due to potential construction delays. So, how do you maintain connectivity in the meantime? While waiting for fiber activation was once the only option, many carriers now offer a two-stage solution for businesses needing immediate bandwidth.
